conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! I can help you reduce food waste with proper storage techniques.

• Cool the rice quickly: Spread the rice on a plate to cool it down faster, ideally within one hour.

• Refrigerate promptly: Store the cooled rice in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Consume within 1-2 days.

• Freezing: For longer storage, freeze the rice in a freezer-safe bag or container. It can last for up to 1 month.

• Recipe to prevent waste: Make egg fried rice (approximately 30 BDT) the next day.

Reducing rice waste can lower methane emissions from landfills.

Next step: Refrigerate your leftover rice properly for use within the next 1-2 days.

conversationHistory.userMessage: What vegetables are rich in vitamins?
conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! I can help you find some affordable, vitamin-rich vegetables.

• Focus on dark leafy greens and colorful options like spinach and carrots.

• Spinach (palong shak): Rich in Vitamin A and C, around 20 BDT per kg.

• Carrots (gajor): Excellent source of Vitamin A, costing about 30 BDT per kg.

These vitamins are essential for good vision and a healthy immune system.

Next step: Include spinach and carrots in your next meal for a vitamin boost.

conversationHistory.userMessage: Suggest a meal plan for 300 BDT
conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! Here is a cost-effective meal plan for you:

• Chicken and vegetable curry with rice (approximately 250 BDT). Chicken provides protein, while vegetables offer essential vitamins.

• Lentil soup (dal) with rice and a side of spinach (approximately 150 BDT). This is a budget-friendly and nutritious option.

Shopping tip: Buy seasonal vegetables from local markets for better prices.

Next step: Try the lentil soup with rice for a budget-friendly meal.
